title: Red Receives a Mission from Her Mother
summary: Red's mother instructs her to deliver a basket of treats to her sick grandmother across the forest. Red protests, wanting to attend the village dance instead, but agrees after her mother insists, warning her not to stray from the path. Red packs the basket, resolves to complete her errand quickly, and sets out determinedly.

title: Red Encounters the Mysterious Woodsman
summary: As Red walks through the forest, she encounters a charming woodsman named Luc who warns her about wolves and offers to escort her. Red, motivated by independence and curiosity, declines but flirts with Luc, who is intrigued by her spirit and secretly decides to follow her at a distance for her safety.

title: A Chance Meeting with the Wolf
summary: Red meets a suave, enigmatic stranger—the Wolf—who cleverly strikes up a conversation, fishing for information about her destination. Red, sensing his interest, teases him with vague answers and challenges his intentions. The Wolf, motivated by hunger and cunning, decides to race Red to Granny's house.

title: Wolf Arrives at Granny's Cottage
summary: The Wolf arrives at Granny's cottage before Red, tricks Granny into opening the door, and locks her in a closet instead of harming her, planning to impersonate her. He hurriedly puts on Granny's clothes, motivated by his plan to deceive Red and get closer to her.

title: Red’s Suspicion Grows
summary: Red arrives at the cottage and immediately notices inconsistencies in 'Granny's' appearance and voice. She questions 'Granny' pointedly, growing more suspicious with each evasive answer. Red must decide whether to confront the imposter or attempt to escape.

title: The Woodsman Intervenes
summary: Luc, having tracked Red, bursts into the cottage and confronts the Wolf. A struggle ensues, with Red aiding Luc by distracting the Wolf. Motivated by his feelings for Red, Luc overpowers the Wolf and frees Granny from the closet.

title: Truths and Choices Revealed
summary: With the immediate danger past, Red confronts Luc and the Wolf about their true intentions. The Wolf confesses he was captivated by Red and wanted her attention, while Luc admits his growing affection for her. Red decides to forgive the Wolf and chooses to attend the dance with Luc, inviting both him and Granny to join.

title: A New Beginning at the Village Dance
summary: At the village dance, Red, Luc, Granny, and even the reformed Wolf attend together. Red and Luc share a dance, solidifying their budding romance, while the Wolf, now accepted by the villagers, begins his own journey of change. The story ends with Red choosing her own path, surrounded by her new and old friends.
